metadata.title: CVE-2020-36427 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
GNOME gThumb before 3.10.1 allows an application crash via a malformed JPEGimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gthumb - 3.12.0-2
gthumb-data - 3.12.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gthumb package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.0-2').
